data.Name: Gowan
data.Bio: Lawrence Gowan is a Canadian musician, born in Glasgow, Scotland on November 22, 1956. Gowan was a solo artist for over fifteen years prior to becoming the keyboardist and vocalist for Styx. His musical style is often classified in the category of progressive rock, as well as singer-songwriter Pop. His career: At the age of nineteen, he earned an ARCT in classical piano performance from the Royal Conservatory of Music, in Toronto. Upon graduation, he enjoyed modest local success with the band Rhinegold in 1976. Read more on Last.fm

data.Name: Barenaked Ladies
data.Bio: Barenaked Ladies (often abbreviated BNL) is a Canadian alternative rock band currently composed of Jim Creeggan, Kevin Hearn, Ed Robertson, and Tyler Stewart, formerly featuring Andy Creeggan and Steven Page. Page left the band amicably in February 2009 to pursue solo projects, and March 7th, 2009 saw the band's first show on stage as a foursome in Orlando, Florida. Tyler Stewart proudly emblazoned his drum-set with a "Fantastic 4" logo. In March 2010, they released 'All In Good Time', their first post-Page studio album. Read more on Last.fm

data.Name: The Guess Who
data.Bio: The Guess Who is a rock band from Winnipeg, Manitoba that was one of the first Canadian groups to establish a major successful following both in their own country as well as abroad. In their late 60s and early 70s heyday, the guys took influence from late period British invasion bands as well as stuck alongside them on the charts. They were notably the first Canadian rock n roll group to have a #1 hit in the United States thanks to the success of 1970's "American Woman". Read more on Last.fm

data.Name: Barenaked Ladies
data.Subtitle: with Gin Blossoms, Toad the Wet Sprocket
data.Description:
BARENAKED LADIES at Red Rocks Amphitheatre on June 22, 2021 has been rescheduled to June 21, 2022.

There is nothing you need to do as your tickets will be valid for the new date.

 

AEG Presents is thrilled to announce BARENAKED LADIES live at Red Rocks Amphitheatre on Tuesday, June 21, 2022.
